intro: Ilex lilongshanensis, commonly known as the Liling Mountain holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often spiny. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that are an important food source for birds. It is typically found in forested areas at moderate elevations, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
